intro: Dicrastylis sessilifolia, commonly known as the sessile-leaf dicrastylis, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wet or swampy areas, preferring moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, and it produces distinctive, three-lobed seeds. Dicrastylis sessilifolia plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and provides habitat for various invertebrates.
